oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Postcard of Camp Gordon sent by Pvt. Joseph W. Knox to his mother
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pvt. Joseph W. Knox of Dyer, Tennessee, sent this postcard of the "Signal Corps at work, Camp Gordon, Atlanta, Ga." to his mother upon his arrival at Camp Merritt, N. J.. He said that he was glad to be in barracks once more and asked her to send a sweater and handkerchiefs. He served in Co. E, 11th Inf. Regt. in the Meuse-Argonne offensive. Honorably discharged in July 1919, he married Ruth Gladhill in 1923, worked as a brick mason and ran a dry cleaners. [See also GWjack018-024, 500-516]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
